From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

On 7 May 2015 at 23:16, Colin Green <colin.green1@...> wrote:
>
> Finally, random search has no equivalent of RMSProp's 'per variable'
> learning rate. Hence it has that problem of trying to use a step size
> that is good for all of the variables, but the success of RMSProp
> suggests that the 'one step size fits all' approach is problematic.

However, this is might be a good argument for using non-uniform weight
mutations, e.g. Gaussian (SharpNEAT performs a mix of uniform and
Gaussian mutations if my memory serves me).

Colin
